page.title: 01South East Northamptonshire
page.content: Our map section covers part of east Northamptonshire, it is a typical example of this part of the county. It is mostly farming land (parts of which are reclaimed mining land) dotted with small towns. On our map we have a small town called Irthlingborough which has a population of 5,500 and in the north east of our map there is a corner of Finedon which has a population of 4,500. The A6 goes from London to Carlisle and crosses our section from south east to north west. The river Nene flows across the south west corner of our region on its journey to the Wash near Kings Lynn. The land is rich with iron ore and has been mined since Roman times.
